Description: Upper body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater; interior glazed black with reserved band near top of sherd; exterior: at top of sherd, part of reserved band at junction of rim and body; below, red-figure decoration consisting of satyr to left (only wreathed head with added white leaves with yellow wash and upper body with right hand holding leafy branch remaining), reaching to right and looking back; at left, edge of tympanon decorated with dots; at far right, part of undetermined motif, perhaps finger tips.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0219) (Phase 1)
